extendedIngredients.name: chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1.6 lbs (750 g) boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips

extendedIngredients.name: condensed cream of celery soup
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (284 mL) CAMPBELL'S® Condensed Low Fat Cream of Celery Soup

extendedIngredients.name: green bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small green pepper, cut into strips

extendedIngredients.name: monterey jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (250 mL) Monterey Jack cheese, shredded

extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small red pepper, cut into strips

extendedIngredients.name: salsa
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (250 mL) PACE® chunky salsa, divided

recipes.title: Monterey Chicken Fajitas

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken on the menu? Try pairing with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned (about 5 minutes). Add peppers, onions and seasoning and cook until veggies are tender-crisp and chicken is cooked through (about 7-10 minutes).Add the soup and  cup of salsa, and bring to a simmer. Stir in the corn. Cook 2-3 minutes, until heated through.Spoon about  cup filling into each tortilla and serve with remaining salsa, cheese and lime wedges.

steps.step: Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned (about 5 minutes).
Add peppers, onions and seasoning and cook until veggies are tender-crisp and chicken is cooked through (about 7-10 minutes).

Add the soup and  cup of salsa, and bring to a simmer. Stir in the corn. Cook 2-3 minutes, until heated through.Spoon about  cup filling into each tortilla and serve with remaining salsa, cheese and lime wedges.
